results.text: The 'badge' identifying Christ-followers is their love for one another - characterized by (1) involvement, (2) commitment, and (3) sacrifice.
Believers are to lay down their lives for one another.
To not love another believer is to disobey God - sin against God.
For believers, there is to be a consistency between loving God and loving others.
Believers can define love by the sacrificial act of Jesus Christ in laying down His life for them.
Saying one loves God doesn't make it so.
If anyone says, "I love God God," yet hates his brother, he is a liar.
Whoever loves God must love his brother.
How can God's love dwell in one who has the capacity but refuses to meet another's needs?
Believers are to love with actions and in truth - not simply with words.
Teachers are to speak the truth in love.
Teaching the truth in love will help believers grow up in Christ.
Teachers need to encourage believers with love to do his or her work as God has gifted them.
When a disciple maker knows his departure from his disciples of three years is near, the love for the disciples intensifies.

What  God or Son of God - even any god known to man - would say after three years of life with Peter, James, and John, etc. \"having loved His own who were in the world, He loved them to the end\" and then to take a basin of water with a towel and wash their feet?
Disciples of Jesus are uniquely marked or identified by the kind of love they show one another - sacrificial, involved, and committed L-O-V-E.
Repentance and forgiveness of sins are linked.
Forgiveness is requisite among disciples of Jesus Christ.
There is no hope of forgiveness for those who revile the Spirit of God and His work.
God's forgiveness experienced elicits awe and respect from the recipients.
When one realizes the magnitude of the forgiveness from God in his salvation, that's one will unashamedly love the LORD.
Faith in the person and work of Christ results in forgiveness of one sins.
Christ-followers are to forgive from their heart (inner man) those who offend or sin against them.

Recognizing God\'s sovereign heart and hand at work \'behind\' your ugly or unpleasant circumstance will allow you to not only forgive those who (by their hands) put you in the ugly, unpleasant circumstance, but even love them openly.
One who takes lightly God's grace upon grace by disobeying the LORD again may find a high price is to be paid.
God gives grace to some genealogical lines - more in one line than another - to do what is right in His eyes.
God gives some of His faithful ones superior wisdom, humble spirit, and Spirit-led boldness along with favor by national leaders.
Understanding the Word of God is a gift from God.
God's grace plus God-honoring heart commitment can serve a Christ-follower well.

Those IN CHRIST should thank the LORD for (1) His mercy (having been at enmity), (2) His grace and favor - being beyond numbering or over the top toward them, (3) His imparting ability to fulfill His will, (4) His considering them trustworthy, (5) His appointing each one a role and responsibility of service and all this accompanied by a supply of faith toward Him and love for Him and others.
Those IN CHRIST who place themselves under Christ as LORD will know His grace, His mercy, and His peace.

Those IN CHRIST were saved (as a matter of fact) (1) through the kindness and love of God in Jesus Christ, (2) according to God's mercy, (3) not on the basis of works (deeds) of righteousness they practiced, (4) through the bathing or washing that came with regeneration (recreation, new birth), (5) through the renewing (to make fresh, new or complete change for the better) accomplished by the Holy Spirit, (6) have been justified (legally declared righteous), and (7) become heirs (sonship) based on the hope of eternal life.
Salvation from sins is by God\'s grace and certain to all who receive Jesus Christ.
God does not give His Holy Spirit to believers in measure - 1/2, 1/3, 3/4, 2/3 - but in full, whole, entirely, completely.
It is God\'s grace or favor toward a Christ-follower that really makes him or advances him in being more Christlike and in doing God\'s will.
Those who have received life-impacting mercy and grace from God have a keen opportunity to surrender the rest of their life under His Lordship.

God may grant to some - early in their life - the grace gift of a fear toward Him with a commitment to godliness and with this grace the experience of being ostracized by an ungodly culture - all in preparation for fruitful ministry ahead.
Those God graces with management or leadership abilities can exercise it in whatever setting they find themselves.
God chooses to make a few among His faithful to be very wise and able leaders at the early age of thirty.
God grants understanding into the revelations He grants His servants - understanding is at various levels, not always to full clarity of a word.
To purpose in one\'s heart to honor God - God\'s Word, God\'s ways - is a potent driving force when energized by God\'s grace and will.

Those Christ-followers God is using among an idolatrous culture - even serving the government - may be promoted to very high ranking positions due to the wisdom, character, and revelation(s) given them by God.
When God chooses a man from among His people to be wise, faithful, and useful to preserve or carry forward His name - even in the midst of an idolatrous culture, He can and will do so.
Some people's religion is made up of external conformity to man-made guidelines.
Some religious teachers do so only to make money.
Some people fear the\' operators\' of acceptable religion.
One man\'s life (heart) - impacting experience with Jesus can be enough to foster faith enough to rebuke the leaders of acceptable religion (who have NO SUCH experience).

Those religious leaders and institutions will \"put out\" or remove Christ-followers who have an intimate and powerful, obedient, faith-oriented walk with Jesus Christ - believers of the Word and doers of the Word.
Those aligned with God IN CHRIST know there is only One to whom they give worship and devotion - the LORD only.
God would have families worship Him together.
God's people are not to worship in any way idols of any kind.
Christ-followers are not to mix worship of God with worship of any other.
God will direct His people in where and how to worship Him.
Christ-followers must have times of celebration and feast in gratitude to God for His work among them.
Christ-followers are to purely worship God AS HE has instructed.
God's people are not to worship Him as idolaters worship their gods.
Christ-followers are not to merge religious practices with those not following God.
Gratitude to God is expressed in worship with offerings, praises, prayer, publicly, and with spiritual leaders present.
Spiritual experiences are not to be worshipped or honored.
Some acts of worship and honor of Jesus Christ will be ridiculed by some NOT SO IN LOVE WITH JESUS.
There are times to worship Jesus and times to care for the poor.
Christ-followers must keep prayer and worship of the LORD preeminent when they gather.
Prayer - not merchandizing - is to be 'center stage' when Christ-followers gather.
Love for God will result in personal and public worship and devotion to the LORD.
It is no wonder the name of our God is great and awesome, worthy of praise, exaltation, and worship.
People in idolatrous cultures worship idols without regard for Almighty God.
Those in Christ who are led or forced to live in the midst of an idolatrous culture are free to serve the peoples - even in the government - but not serve and worship idols and false gods.
God's love for His servants is unfailing.
Expressing God's love and power to others is more important than keeping religious traditions.
Disciples of Jesus are to love one another IN THE MANNER Christ loved His disciples - involvement, commitment, and sacrifice.
God has blessed every Christ-follower with EVERY SPIRITUAL BLESSING in the inner man (unseen, spiritual realm) by putting us IN CHRIST so that we should be holy before Him.
God intends for His people to enjoy the blessings He has given them.
Christ-followers are to bring gifts to God commensurate with the blessings God has given them.
God's blessings to His people are to be enjoyed by them however or wherever.
God will bring blessings to those who walk in obedience to Him.

Some loving, well-meaning Christ-followers try tight arguments and tears to dissuade a Spirit-led Christ-follower from doing what he thoroughly believes - and is yielded to do - the Spirit is leading him to do.

The size of one's SHIELD OF FAITH is proportionate to the (1) knowledge / assurance of his / her salvation (place in Christ) and the (2) working knowledge of Scripture (the amount of and ability to apply in life).
A servant of God must have active confidence in God to obey in full the strange (speak to an altar) and sometimes dangerous (anger a king) words revealed to him.
Sanctification (spiritual maturity) comes as a work of the Holy Spirit and involves the same kind of faith (believing God's Word) as does salvation.
Christ-followers may make their plans, but trust only the LORD to 'direct his / her steps' to do the LORD's will.
He who continues to fear / trust God will be satisfied.
God knows and acknowledges when people are really trusting Him - taking Him at His Word.
Faith in God is acting now on what God says as though you can see past or beyond what God says to what He will do.
Don't be afraid of the opposition you will face when carrying out God's will.
People who lack faith will experience less activity of God.
Those who really believe Jesus - is who He is - humbly approach Him.
God has set apart all who come to Him in faith.
Folks who express faith in Jesus Christ experience what He wants to do in them.
Believing Jesus is more important than believing the latest news.
Faith in God prepares people for what God is going to do.
Faith in God moves men to action.
Trusting Jesus involves entrusting oneself to Him and what He says He will do.
Those who truly believe Jesus ask Him to do things impossible.
Faith in God and living in righteousness are linked.
All people need to turn toward God in repentance and have faith in the Lord Jesus Christ in order to be saved.
Faith in the person and work of Christ results in forgiveness of one sins.
Some genuine expressions of faith in the LORD are at depths of experience which by God's grace will increase to greater or deeper faith in the LORD.
Asking is believing Jesus still answers according to what will glorify His Father.
Asking is believing Jesus went to sit at the Father's right hand.
Asking the Father evidences trust - an act of faith believing you are asking acording to God's revealed will.
To be walking with God in obedience by faith - experiencing His presence daily - is an awesome and available reality for those IN CHRIST.
Being born again or born of the Spirit is a mystical experience - much of which cannot be seen by the eye or even fully understood fully at the outset.
Christ-followers need to trust God to do bigger-than-possible things to accomplish His will through them.
One man\'s life (heart) - impacting experience with Jesus can be enough to foster faith enough to rebuke the leaders of acceptable religion (who have NO SUCH experience).
One\'s \"sin reality\" is fully dealt with (from God\'s perspective) adequately ONLY by believing in one\'s heart Jesus died as his/her Savior - for payment of the penalty of sins.
The LORD speaks His will, the Christ-follower believes (acting upon the Word), and then God reveals His glory and power.
Those IN CHRIST, filled with the Spirit, and doing God\'s will manifest the glory of God and  of His Son.

God may grant to some - early in their life - the grace gift of a fear toward Him with a commitment to godliness and with this grace the experience of being ostracized by an ungodly culture - all in preparation for fruitful ministry ahead.
One\'s offering to God should not be a cheap, inferior, substitute for a true, heart-level gift of love, faith, and obedience to the LORD.

Those who would be men of faith - taking God at His Word for salvation and all that is in it - are those who (1) receive God\'s promises, verse 15, (2) remember God\'s promises, verses 3-4, (3) experience God\'s promises, verses 11-14, (4) pass on God\'s promises, verses 15-16, and (5) cling to God\'s promises, verses 19-22.
Christ-followers are to do what God says on the basis of trust in God.
Those IN CHRIST may speak confidently to those in authority in pagan, idolatrous cultures what God has revealed to them to say.
So often the fuller revelation or fuller experience of God comes after stepping out in faith - after beginning the journey of obedience.
God gives grace with faith to the humble.
God-honoring faith means \'take God at His Word\' - whatever it is God says, you count it as SO.
Some expressions of genuine heart-faith received by the LORD are quite humble in nature and quite public in expression.
Belief in the LORD grows (deepens, increases) as Christ-followers repeatedly experience the LORD - His power, His glory, and His unfolding purposes.
The name of the LORD abides in all who are IN CHRIST - following Christ by faith.
Some teachers are formally (and highly) educated.
Educated teachers who teach with enthusiasm can still learn more (need to be open to further learning).
The one who ignores the discipline thinks very little of himself.
The teacher's way of life and teaching message must agree.
If one refuses to change after being instructed and rebuked many times, that one is headed for destruction.
It is a serious matter to continuously reject instruction and rebuking.
Believers need to be instructed in the things of God.
It is wise to shun evil.
The transformation of the LORD wants for His children involves the renewing of the mind.
If a person wants to grow wise, he ought to walk with wise people.
It is better to be humble and make a change following a rebuke then be proud and suffer the consequences.
A godly teacher invites and encourages his students to pay attention to his teaching and observe his life closely.
A truly wise person continues to increase in wisdom.
Fools despise wisdom and discipline.
A faithful (consistent, trustworthy) believer can set a good example.
As one begins to recognize God, knowledge and wisdom are not far behind.
The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge.
Believers need to be able to give reasons why they have hope in Jesus Christ.
It is not God's will that a believer conform in mind and heart with the world around them.
Wisdom is also peace loving and considerate.
This world and the spiritual world are not alike or in agreement.
Children should be taught God's truth from early childhood.
There is a mental re-orientation through which a believer must go in order to line up with finding and doing God's will.
Believers are to put into practice what they have learned from those who taught them and showed them godly living.
Jesus Christ is spoken of (written about) in the writings of Moses and the writings of the prophets. XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
People need to have the Scriptures explained.
Sometimes adults must be taught as little children.
A wise teacher can discern the level at which the student is going to best learn.
A believer has to keep himself from evil.
By continuing in the Word the believer will become thoroughly equipped to do all God has for him.
The teachers job is to explain to people the Scriptures.
Symbols can be particularly useful in communicating a message to future generations.
The message of God is not the symbol, but for what the symbol symbolizes.
Study and practice of God's Word is indispensable to the one who would be thoroughly equipped.
Teachers may need to be creative in order for the pupils to learn.
Lip service without a life service is no service.
Believers need a commitment to obey what God says to them.
Believers are to focus there thinking on things that are noble, right, pure, lovely, admirable, excellent, and/or praiseworthy.
When one applies godly truths, the God of peace will be with them.
It is vitally important for a believer to keep on studying, rehearsing, and practicing what he has learned.
Symbols prompt others to inquire into their meaning.
The emphasis is first learn or know, then do.
Got speaks to his people through the use of symbols.
Obedience leads to additional insight and understanding.
If people would study the Scriptures, God would show them Jesus Christ.
Those who are a bit resistant to learning (stubborn) will need to be taught small amounts of material and have it repeated over and over.
Verbiage about God without obedience is not the least pleasing to God.

Some religious teachers do so only to make money.

The value of 'wisdom from God' is beyond comparison.
A prudent man 'foresees' and makes appropriate adjustments.

Those who attain great wealth, wisdom, and recognition would do well to recognize God as the Source.
Those who diligently seek wisdom from God will find it.
God-honoring wise counsel should be part of the planning for Christ-followers.
As sure as eating a honeycomb is sweet on the tongue, so is the knowledge of God's wisdom by a Christ-follower to his soul - along with a real, meaningful future.

People of God need to listen to a leader who is filled with the Spirit of wisdom.
With the Word dwelling richly in the teacher's life, the teacher can minister with all wisdom.
Heavenly wisdom is to be lived out in a believer's life each day.
Life with honor, peace, and riches is characteristic of the believer who lives God's wisdom.
Peacemakers who wisely sow in peace raise a harvest of righteousness.

Believers are not to provide for the needs of false teachers.

God's wisdom beckons to all people.
When God's wisdom is applied in life, it makes simpleminded people gain prudence and the foolish gain understanding.
Wisdom is also peace loving and considerate.
A man who gains wisdom is first one who fears the LORD.
In addition, wisdom is submissive, full of mercy, and good fruit as well as impartial and sincere.
Even the wisdom apart from Godly wisdom can see moral corruption in others.

It will be critically important for Christ-followers living in pagan or idolatrous cultures to exercise God-given wisdom in making appeals to obtain the right or opportunity to alternative (to the culture) choices or actions.
The Word of God is THE SOURCE above all sources for wisdom and understanding.
Those nations, peoples, or cultures which fully embrace and apply God\'s Word can be recognized above others as a wise and understanding nation.

The one in the body of Christ who thinks he can make the right choices apart from seeking greater spiritual wisdom and understanding from those gifted so by God\'s Spirit is thinking presumptuously - such is a danger to himself and others.
A Christ-follower in an intimate relationship with the LORD gains wisdom on living as God grants him a clearer view of the brevity of his life in view of eternity.
Godly wisdom is made known by God to the \'inner man\' of those IN CHRIST and yielded to God.
Those sent by God \"behind enemy lines\" for His purposes must go by faith and interact - using the wisdom of the Spirit - with those they encounter.
Those who value (maximize) their days (realizing the brevity of days) gain a heart of wisdom.
Sometimes God\'s grace or favor manifests as wisdom - practical wisdom - in those chosen so by God.
There is a time in gathering of spiritual leaders - whether the leader or teacher - to fall to their knees in prayer - praying together humbly bowed before God.

Fellow leaders - being used greatly, out front, maybe for years, known among Christ-followers and Spirit-filled - will take opportunity to meet and fellowship when they find themselves in the same area.
A great leader of God's people may simply be listed among the genealogies (without distinction) after generations have passed.

Spiritual leaders should be interceding for Christ-followers to be 'filled with all the fullness of God' as Christ Himself was filled with the fullness of God - becoming Christlike, spiritually mature.
Leaders of God's people need to learn well God's Word.
Leaders of God's people are to practice God's Word - carefully and thoroughly.
God's peoples should elect leaders from among them to govern over them.
Leaders of God's people should not consider themselves better than others.
Leaders help their followers keep on the right assignment.
Spiritual leaders give their most trusted 'next level' leaders 'inside' or special information.
Leaders must lead in difficult, challenging situations.
Leaders should be very careful about who they are trying to please.
Christ-followers - leaders particularly - must use wisely the time God gives them.
Spiritual leaders endeavor to see that their team members have what is needed to acomplish their various, assigned tasks.

The local assemblies of Christ-followers are to have multiple, appointed spiritual leaders who meet the qualifications and engage in carrying out their responsibilities: Qualifications are God-honoring character applied and proven in the family and community and Responsibilities of (1) knowing God's Word and its application in life, (2) teach soundly the Word of God so the people of God can grow in Christ-likeness, interact as Christ-followers, and engage in good works, (3) promote the Gospel of grace and new birth by the Holy Spirit, and (4) protect against divisiveness in the assembly.

A leader among God\'s people is to avoid multiple wives; keeping his sexual passions under control.

Overt sin among God\'s people must be dealt with at the \'leader\' level before it will stop among the people.

It will be critically important for Christ-followers living in pagan or idolatrous cultures to exercise God-given wisdom in making appeals to obtain the right or opportunity to alternative (to the culture) choices or actions.
The Word of God is THE SOURCE above all sources for wisdom and understanding.
Those nations, peoples, or cultures which fully embrace and apply God\'s Word can be recognized above others as a wise and understanding nation.

The one in the body of Christ who thinks he can make the right choices apart from seeking greater spiritual wisdom and understanding from those gifted so by God\'s Spirit is thinking presumptuously - such is a danger to himself and others.
A Christ-follower in an intimate relationship with the LORD gains wisdom on living as God grants him a clearer view of the brevity of his life in view of eternity.
Godly wisdom is made known by God to the \'inner man\' of those IN CHRIST and yielded to God.
Those sent by God \"behind enemy lines\" for His purposes must go by faith and interact - using the wisdom of the Spirit - with those they encounter.
Those who value (maximize) their days (realizing the brevity of days) gain a heart of wisdom.
Sometimes God\'s grace or favor manifests as wisdom - practical wisdom - in those chosen so by God.

The size of one's SHIELD OF FAITH is proportionate to the (1) knowledge / assurance of his / her salvation (place in Christ) and the (2) working knowledge of Scripture (the amount of and ability to apply in life).
From a humble heart, one would do well to remain in God's Word daily - applying it to life daily.
To rebuke or oppose a brother in sin - do so to his face (personally, face to face) with the Word of God and in the grace of God.
Those who do God's Word as a way of life will be rewarded.
Christ-followers must HOLD FAST GOD'S WORD - especially in these later days.
God extends mercy and grace to those who hear His Word with a tender heart humble themselves, weep, and seek His face.
Sometimes a faithful messenger / prophet of God is given by God a negative / judgmental (even death sentence) word to pass on to the people.
Some who rise to leadership among God's people have no regard for God or His Word.
Those with spiritual authority from the LORD need from time to time to exercise that authority to urge obedience to the Spirit and the Word of God.
The manifest presence of God (which comes to His children in close communion with Him) is conditioned on honoring God's Word with obedience by faith out of devotion to Him.
Those who treasure God's Word will find God's Word will keep them IN righteousness and OUT OF sin.
God gives His Word to those servants He chooses to deliver, in His name, certain 'calling out' of sin(s).

A spiritual leader who is being used by God speaks to (1) orient / the people (society) to God and God's Word and to (2) encourage all to abandon idols / sins in order to (3) honor God with their life.
The value of 'wisdom from God' is beyond comparison.

A prophet or spokesman for God will have to have (1) Holy Spirit enabled boldness to speak judgment / condemnation into the face of a king / national leader and have to (2) be certain of the word he got from God.
God many choose to extend some more mercy toward one who humbles himself greatly on the word of God's judgment / condemnation.
Those who despise and disobey God's Word pay a high price.
God-honoring wise counsel should be part of the planning for Christ-followers.
As sure as eating a honeycomb is sweet on the tongue, so is the knowledge of God's wisdom by a Christ-follower to his soul - along with a real, meaningful future.
Understanding the Word of God is a gift from God.
Christ-followers are to blamelessly practice God's Word.
Spiritual leaders are responsible to speak God's Word to God's people.
Leaders of God's people need to learn well God's Word.
Leaders of God's people are to practice God's Word - carefully and thoroughly.
God will bring to pass His Word.
God's people are to do what He says - not taking from it or adding to it.
God gives what He wants said to His spokesperson.
Praising God for fulfilling His Word may involve special offerings brought by all who will praise Him.
Time should be taken in public to acknowledge fulfillment of God's Word.
Those who reject or ignore God's Word spoken by His spokesperson will have to account to God for such.
Spiritual leaders are to periodically review publicly with God's people what God has said.
When God's people return to Him, they come to obey His Word with all of heart and soul.
Spiritual leaders are to charge those they lead to keep God's Word.
Obeying God's Word is not too difficult, nor is it beyond reach of God's people.
The people need to know God's Word so they will fear the LORD and so they will follow Him.
Real life is found in God's Word.
Spiritual leaders must keep God's Word before the people of God.
Spiritual leaders know they must give the people God's Word.
God's Word to a recipient soul is like water to a tender young plant.
God fulfills what He says He will do.
Some ministry of the Word will not produce fruit or a particular anticipated outcome.
God's Word OPEN reveals and discloses things, situations, and attitudes.
God's Word will stand true forever.
Though all creation will collapse, the Word of God will stand forever.
A teacher needs to be ready to teach God's Word.
Those who disagree with the teaching of Jesus may plot against those bringing the message.
Some are still startled at the fulfillment of God's Word.
As a lamp is intended for light, so the Word of God is intended to be fruitful.
God's Word is perfect, trustworthy, right, radiant, pure, sure, and righteous.
topics: Perfect, trustworthy, right, radiant, pure, sure, righteous

results.text: Sometimes crowds gather to hear the teaching of God's Word.
Keeping God's Word brings great reward.
Spiritual leaders need to know God's Word.
God's Word is more precious than gold.
God's Word - prophecies - will be fulfilled as a matter of fact.
When a crowd - drawn by God - gathers, it would be a great time to teach them God's Word.
Distribution of God's Word as distribution of light is not to be intentionally limited or restricted.
Those who get into God's Word come close to eternal life.
When a message comes from God, God's people need to consider carefully the words.
Some ministry of the Word will produce much fruit and an anticipated outcome.
The Word of God is to be considered - given a thoughtful hearing.
Those who discard the Word will loose that and more.
Those without Christ may find teaching about Christ and the kingdom delightful.
Those who 'sow' God's Word anticipate some fruitful results or outcome.
It is appropriate to teach God's Word using stories and analogies.
More - word or insight - will be given to those who are receiving the Word.
Those who are afraid of the LORD and the impact of His teaching may want to kill those who teach the Word.
The words of the LORD are flawless - pure as can be.
It is important to spend time in God's Word.
Those open to the truth find the truth of God amazing.
Those who live God's Word have a good understanding.
God's Word - His light and truth - lead followers into the personal presence of God.
topics: Truth, light, followers, presence of God

results.text: Blessed is the one God teaches and trains from His Word.
God's Word is sure, making wise the simple.
One who delights in following God's Word will be stable, productive, durable, and successful.
God's Word is the final word.
Disciples need God's Word.
The words of the LORD are pure words.
A believer can choose to let the Word of Christ dwell in them richly.
God uses the Word to prune the lives of His children.
Heavenly wisdom is to be lived out in a believer's life each day.
Life with honor, peace, and riches is characteristic of the believer who lives God's wisdom.
Even high governmental employees need instructed in the ways of the LORD.
A man who wants to live right should ask the Lord to teach him how to live.
When people have been without spiritual input for a period of time, hearing the Word of God can grab their attention.
When God is reviving a group of people, there will be an awesome respect for His Word.
A teacher of God's truth can identify false teachers.
One with a discerning heart seeks knowledge.
Godly instruction can lead to godly living.
When God's Word is learned and applied, the simple become wise and the weak become strong.
Teaching should be based on Scriptures and what the Holy Spirit says.
A father should teach his child that learning and applying God's Word is of great value to him and will result in significant rewards.
Give it all you've got to apply what a parent or wise person teaches you.
Memorizing Scripture is an invaluable asset in guarding against committing sins.
People want to know what God's Word means when they are experiencing a spiritual revival.
Teachers can wonder away from the truth.
One responsible for teaching God's Word serves at least two purposes, (1) encourage others with sound doctrine and (2) refute those who oppose it.
When God's salvation message is proclaimed and people believe, they are saved.
Teach as much of the truth as possible as often as possible because the time will come when men will turn away from wanting to hear it.
When one lives according to God's Word, his life will be kept pure.
Those who are ignorant of God and His ways will live confused lives.
In addition, wisdom is submissive, full of mercy, and good fruit as well as impartial and sincere.
Instruction and explanation of and from God's Word is part of a spiritual revival.

When a Christ-follower experiences true, heart-level brokenness over his sins against the LORD - realizing "the Word of God is true and I am wrong," - that one is coming closer to knowing victory over sin through Christ.
Those IN CHRIST need to know (and act on) the whole of what God says about a matter - knowing His Word thoroughly, believing the Word, and living according to the Word.

There is a great joy to be experienced and owned by disciples of Jesus who come to know (1) He lives eternally at God's right hand and (2) all the promises (Word and words) of Jesus and Father are true.

Spiritual leaders are to repeatedly teach and exhort the Christ-followers they influence (1) to consider those (even unbelievers) they work for worth respecting and honoring (2) expressing a good work ethic SO the name of God and the teachings of God may not be blasphemed AND those who work for believers (Christ-followers) (1) to not look down on (take advantage of) them just because they too follow Christ but (2) give them good service because believers and beloved are benefited.
Spiritual leaders declare to those they influence, meticulously guard what teaching of God's truth has been entrusted to you and avoid deviating from the truth.
The Father told Jesus that lack of love is behind disobedience to God's Word.

A spiritual leader IN CHRIST entrusts to his protg the injunction to "teach NO other doctrine" - the Gospel is 'eternal life experienced by faith in the person and work of Jesus Christ' - because of the spiritual endowments he sees in the protg urging him to exercise those endowments to their fullest while trusting in God and keeping a clear conscience.

An effective spiritual leader (1) acknowledges himself as a willingly submissive servant of God, (2) can name his gifting from the LORD, (3) affirms his trust in God as a chosen (by grace) one, (4) acknowledges the Truth, agrees or aligns with godliness - loving fear of God, reverence toward God - (5) lives out of the hope of God's promised eternal (kind of) life - knowing God cannot lie, (6) declares with his proclamation gift God's Gospel message, and (7) functions out of God's expressed will and Word.

A spiritual leader or disciple maker may be aware of a prophetic word or prompting identifying one to whom he is to commit or entrust the Word of God for the purpose of proclamation and propagation of God's Word.

There are those who profess or assent to know God but their lives are consistently contradictory to knowing God (destable, hard-headed, unpersuadable) such are disqualified, unworthy, rejected from spiritual service - especially from leadership roles.
Those IN CHRIST who do God's will - what all God commands of them - show the world and its ruler they love Father supremely.

Churches must be on guard of God's Word (Truth, Bible) because some (proclaimers) (1) have strayed from solid doctrine, (2) have turned to empty words, (3) and wish to be (known as) experts in the Bible - but lack Spirit-granted understanding of God's Word.
A lack of real love for the LORD is the main reason behind disobedience to God's Word.

Those IN CHRIST who are staying intimately related to Christ and in whom the Word of God is staying active ARE TO ASK what they desire (as yielded, submissive servants) and what they ask will as a matter of fact be done for them.
Once a follower of Jesus experiences Jesus alive (revelation of Jesus) and a confirmation of His promised Word (words revealed or fulfilled) the "heart joy" they experience cannot be taken from them.

All the time, but more so in a day in which heresies and apostacy abound, a spiritual leader insists to his protg to "exercise unbroken vigilence" on the teachings of God's Word as has been entrusted to you - avoiding (1) common, empty babling and (2) opposing ideas (falsely named knowledge) BECAUSE some have deviated from "truth faith teaching."
Oh, how the LORD wants those who are His to trust Him - believe His every word.
Spiritual leaders and their churches need strictly warned to not deviate from the sound teaching of the Gospel of Jesus Christ and the practice of God's Word.

How meaningful and beneficial for a senior spiritual leader to write an instructional letter to a young, up and coming spiritual leader - meaningful as the senior includes the both of them as recipients of the same salvation, grace, and peace from the LORD above and beneficial as the senior is passing on to the younger a Spirit-taught collection instructing him how the assemblies of believers are to carry on in Christ.
Stay with Jesus' teaching and what is spiritually healthy and be content in Christ.
Proper superintending and teaching of the Word may well involve exhaustive labor (much effort) in the Word.

Those who (1) serve the body of Christ (assembly of believers) well as superintendents and (2) work exhaustively in the Word and teaching the Word are worthy of double honor or respects in the body of Christ.

Spiritual leaders must know and hold fast to God's Word as taught by God's Spirit and confirmed - especially where assemblies of Christ-followers are relatively new or young in faith BECAUSE deceivers and false teachers - sometimes even professing knowledge of God (not actually under Christ's lordship) try to subvert those not grounded in sound doctrine.

A spiritual leader in a time-period of general apostacy MUST (imperative, injunction) (1) draw empowerment out of the grace of God (verse 1), (2) commit God's Word and teachings to proven men capable of teaching others (verse 2), (3) endure troubles and hardships (verses 3-6), (4) ponder your instructions that God give you a fuller understanding of them (verse 7), (5) remember (time and again) the Gospel of Jesus Christ and the whole of God's Word is not chained (restrained) (verses 8-9), (6) remind the faithful men who will teach others - God is faithful and will keep His Word (verse 14), (7) exert energy to rightly deliver God's Word of truth (verse 15), (8) avoid vain conversations (verses 16-18), (9) depart, flee from sin and immature desires (verses 19-22), and (10) avoid arguments and disputes while focusing on patiently and humbly teaching God's truth.
All need reminded God's Word is not chained or restraint - it is working God's work in hearts and lives.

Those IN CHRIST called and gifted to minister God's Word to others in strengthening up the body of Christ must (1) suffer hardships together with others, (2) stay focus on accomplishing the God-given assignment, (3) endeavor according to the revealed (to you) ways and means (strategies and provisions) given you, (4) work hard and long, and (5) keep yourself strong by taking in God's Word day by day (don't try to feed others what you haven't eaten yourself).
If a follower of Christ doubt God's Word, God remains faithful and will keep His Word regardless - God cannot deny His own Word.

Do I know how to recognize a faithful man? Do I know how to commit to others what has been given me?  Can I recognize the truths taught me by God (as opposed to earthly, temporary truths) and thus worthy to be entrusted to others?  Am I focusing on teaching those who are able to teach others also?  Am I consciously depending upon God's gracious supply of strength and empowerment to address this calling of entrusting to faithful men the 'things of God' He has granted to me?
Son who serve God faithfully by proclaiming the gospel of Jesus Christ and explaining God's Word will be considered an evildoer or incarcerated in prison.
God gives understanding to some while others do not understand parables.
When people are gathered, teach them.
Many different topics or ideas can be taught using parables.
Parables are an excellent teaching tool.
God 'sends' some as mobile or itinerate ministers and others as stationary ministers in fulfilling His assignments or purposes.
Some families in Christ are greatly graced by God to have multiple one's in public service to the LORD.
A great leader of God's people may simply be listed among the genealogies (without distinction) after generations have passed.
Under previous covenants olive oil was used to anoint one for the LORD's service - whereas today, the Holy Spirit's indwelling brings the anointing in the inner man.

Christ-followers OUGHT to (1) serve - do whatever for - God only, (2) be supremely devoted to God only, and (3) still be able to work willingly and superiorly for an employer - these are God's priorities for Christ-followers.
God has people prepared to call into training for service.
When Christ-followers serve others, God will be praised.
Use the gift(s) God has given to serve others.
Serve with your whole heart as if serving Christ, Himself.
Christ-followers are priests in the service of God.
Christ-followers are to follow Christ's example of serving others.
Christ-followers are to serve one another in love.
Christ-followers are to serve the living God because of the efficacy of Christ and His shed blood.
The blessing of the LORD is upon all IN CHRIST whose heart atitude remains 'service to all others.'
Those who faithfully serve as deacons earn a good standing in the body of Christ.

Necessary qualifications for a man IN CHRIST to serve the church as a deacon (waiter, servant) include: (1) reverent (respected), (2) not deceitfuil in speech, (3) avoids long time over wine, (4) not eager for sordid (shady) financial gain, (5) holds clearly the message of the Gospel of Christ, (6) has been proven blameless overe time, (7) whose wife is respected (not a false accuser, free from intoxicants, reliable in all things), (8) have one wife, (9) and manages his household well.

The truths and injunctions in 1 Timothy (chapters 1-6) are given as guidelines to the body of Christ in order to know how to carry on as the family of God - the structure of the family of God; who is in charge, their qualifications and functions; the interactions of those within the body of Christ --- all with godliness (piety, revernce for God) at the core in the light of the revelation of Jesus Christ (all that is in that revelation).
Disciples of Christ should have the attitude (and practice) of "I want to serve others" and avoid the attitude "I want others to serve me."

Necessary qualifications to be a bishop or overseer include (1) above reproach (no accusations that stick), (2) a one-wife husband, (3) abstain from all or immoderate use of wine, (4) sober or sound mind (prudent), (5) well behaved, (6) apt to and skillful in teaching, (7) avoids sitting long at wine, (8) not violent, (9) not loving money (greedy), (10) not covetous, (11) governs his household well (including respect from children), (12) not a novice IN CHRIST (a novice as bishop elicits pride and all that goes with pride), and (13) a good testimony or reputation among those outside the body of Christ.
Those who surrender to and serve the LORD will be honored or rewarded one day by the LORD.
A Spirit-led and Spirit-filled servant of the LORD will not be ashamed of where faithful obedience IN CHRIST takes him.

Those IN CHRIST who faithfully fulfill their gifting and calling and experience suffering (incarceration, imprisonment) as part of the outcome are not ashamed of Christ nor their obedience BECAUSE they trust the LORD with a deep-heart persuasion  that God is faithful to keep, affirm, and reward the faithful service rendered in His name.
Some (selected by God) in the body of Christ may be set apart for particular service to the LORD but not set \'above\' any other child of God.
Some teachers are formally (and highly) educated.
Educated teachers who teach with enthusiasm can still learn more (need to be open to further learning).
The one who ignores the discipline thinks very little of himself.
The teacher's way of life and teaching message must agree.
If one refuses to change after being instructed and rebuked many times, that one is headed for destruction.
It is a serious matter to continuously reject instruction and rebuking.
Believers need to be instructed in the things of God.
It is wise to shun evil.
The transformation of the LORD wants for His children involves the renewing of the mind.
If a person wants to grow wise, he ought to walk with wise people.
It is better to be humble and make a change following a rebuke then be proud and suffer the consequences.
A godly teacher invites and encourages his students to pay attention to his teaching and observe his life closely.
A truly wise person continues to increase in wisdom.
Fools despise wisdom and discipline.
A faithful (consistent, trustworthy) believer can set a good example.
As one begins to recognize God, knowledge and wisdom are not far behind.
The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge.
Believers need to be able to give reasons why they have hope in Jesus Christ.
It is not God's will that a believer conform in mind and heart with the world around them.
Wisdom is also peace loving and considerate.
This world and the spiritual world are not alike or in agreement.
Children should be taught God's truth from early childhood.
There is a mental re-orientation through which a believer must go in order to line up with finding and doing God's will.
Believers are to put into practice what they have learned from those who taught them and showed them godly living.
Jesus Christ is spoken of (written about) in the writings of Moses and the writings of the prophets. XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
People need to have the Scriptures explained.
Sometimes adults must be taught as little children.
A wise teacher can discern the level at which the student is going to best learn.
A believer has to keep himself from evil.
By continuing in the Word the believer will become thoroughly equipped to do all God has for him.
The teachers job is to explain to people the Scriptures.
Symbols can be particularly useful in communicating a message to future generations.
The message of God is not the symbol, but for what the symbol symbolizes.
Study and practice of God's Word is indispensable to the one who would be thoroughly equipped.
Teachers may need to be creative in order for the pupils to learn.
Lip service without a life service is no service.
Believers need a commitment to obey what God says to them.
Believers are to focus there thinking on things that are noble, right, pure, lovely, admirable, excellent, and/or praiseworthy.
When one applies godly truths, the God of peace will be with them.
It is vitally important for a believer to keep on studying, rehearsing, and practicing what he has learned.
Symbols prompt others to inquire into their meaning.
The emphasis is first learn or know, then do.
Got speaks to his people through the use of symbols.
Obedience leads to additional insight and understanding.
If people would study the Scriptures, God would show them Jesus Christ.
Those who are a bit resistant to learning (stubborn) will need to be taught small amounts of material and have it repeated over and over.
Verbiage about God without obedience is not the least pleasing to God.
People who receive God's mercy and grace find it VERY DIFFICULT not to tell others about what God did.
Following God's leading brings one to discover God's provision.
When God provides recipients to His Word, He will provide a place to meet, teach, and train those recipients.
Because the family table (meals) is shared by disciples, family members also connect - wives, sons, daughters, etc.
Some families in Christ are greatly graced by God to have multiple one's in public service to the LORD.
Few of God's heritage (families) take very serious His word to multiply and cover the earth - having large families, and stand out greatly when they do.
God would have families worship Him together.
God's blessing of carrying on a family name among His people is to be highly valued.
Those who show disrespect and unconcern for family members will be labeled as such.
Rescuing a loved one can be costly.
Family members are sometimes blinded from seeing God at work in one of their members.
The child's father should be involved in the teaching process.
Children should be trained to accept learning and wisdom all their days.
A Christ-follower is to avoid desiring or taking \'pleasure in\' somebody else\'s wife, but build the relationship he has with his own wife.
In families made up of Christ-followers, the husband and father is the head of the family - the leader, the one responsible, especially in spiritual matters representing the family before God.
Even in a family lineage of men God has used greatly, there may come those adult children who rebel against God and God\'s ways.
A sexually immoral daughter living at home is a shame to her parents - showing disrespect to God and parents.
Unresolved family conflicts, among those not sensitive to Gods Spirit, can rise from broken relationships to the level of murder.
Some victories in the \"field\" are bitter-sweet when the victor returns to find trouble at his home.
Disciple makers at heart (called by God) are always trying to connect with disciples - wherever they find them.
God binds hearts between yielded teacher and yielded receivers of the Word.
God can produce great love and friendship between a teacher of the Word and receptive audience - so much so that parting company can bring real tears flowing by all present.
Because the family table (meals) is shared by disciples, family members also connect - wives, sons, daughters, etc.

Fellow leaders - being used greatly, out front, maybe for years, known among Christ-followers and Spirit-filled - will take opportunity to meet and fellowship when they find themselves in the same area.
Through the common call of discipleship - developing Christ-followers - God can raise up warm relationships between fellow-disciples rather quickly.
There are times when God restricts His people from entering into relationship with certain others for a time.
Newly-weds should be given as much time as possible their first year of marriage in order to develop their relationship.
Disciples of Jesus are to be servant-minded in all relationships.
Christ-followers are related to one another in Christ.
Doing God's will in Christ unites each and every Christ-follower in a spiritual relationship.
A disciple of Christ needs to ask, 'Who are my mother and brothers and sisters?'
The relationship with God and relationships with others are a Christ-follower's primary assignments.
God is committed to restoring His people to intimate relationship with Himself.
Believers are to stay in close relationship with the Lord.
Relationships between you and others are important to God.
The forgiveness toward an offender that Christ calls for is a forgiveness 'from the heart' - a sincere, from the inner man forgiveness.
The stewardship of relationships requires a Christ-follower to be a forgiving person - forgiving those who repent of offenses (sins against you) however many times they repent.

When a sinor offense has come to you from a friend, (1) go alone and tell him the offense - if he agrees and repents, forgive him - restoring the relationship, (2) if he does not agree with you, take two or three others and tell him his sin or offense - if he agrees, forgive him - restoring the relationship, (3) if he refuses to agree with you, tell the assembly of believers the sin or offense - if he repents, forgive him - restoring the relationship; but if he refuses consider him an unrepentant sinner.
Christ-followers are exhorted to seek and give forgiveness in order to heal or restore relationships.
Granting forgiveness to an offender who repents restores a relationship, while refusing to grant forgiveness breaks or hinders a relationship.
Offenses or sins against a friend damages or can break a relationship.
Those in the body of Christ are to be compassionate and merciful toward those who 'wrong' (offend) them.
Those IN CHRIST who remain intimately related to Christ will as a matter of fact toninue to bear fruit - over and over again.
Those whose actions hurt, break, or damage relationships (among those experiencing unity) in the body of Christ are working against God's will.
Those involved in Christ\'s Kingdom-building minister to people - not institutions, projects, or goals.
Those IN CHRIST are not to enter into marriages or other binding contracts with those who are not in Christ - who through intimacy of relationship might well turn one away from following Christ.
God acts to reveal Himself and His salvation to Gentiles as well as Hebrews by sending His messengers and working mighty acts - showing Himself merciful and mighty.
Only those born of God can enter God's presence.
Every and all sin must be atoned and Jesus, the Lamb of God, was the perfect Sacrifice to completely atone for sin.
Salvation from sin should be celebrated by God's people.
Salvation in Christ is received by faith in God's work through Jesus.
Salvation is only possible as God works such in the lives of individuals.
Salvation is not to be more difficult for one people group than for another.
When God's salvation message is proclaimed and people believe, they are saved.
Some have and will yet reject the one and only Jesus in whom is found salvation.
The name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth is the only one which is found salvation.
There is no other name in whom is found salvation - Jesus Christ.
It is necessary to come to and through Jesus Christ to experience God's salvation.

God has already shown He can save  by mercy and grace through Jesus Christ those who blaspheme His work, persecute His followers, and delight in damaging others by lashing out with a nasty or violent spirit.
Since the LORD saved Saul of Tarsus - blaphemer, persecutor, an insulant man - all in Christ today should be encouraged by that example of mercy, grace, and complete patience extended by our LORD.
Those who do not see themselves as sinners will not come to Jesus Christ for salvation.
Women IN CHRIST let their God-ward heart and good works (ordained by God) serve as a platform to collaborate with God in His desire to see all men saved.
Jesus is THE WAY to the Father - there is NO OTHER way.
Jesus Christ (1) abolished death - to render in operative, make of no effect, (2) brought life - full and meaningful, and (3) brought immortality to light (ALL) through the Gospel.
Those who have received God's gift of salvation in Jesus Christ has also received the Holy Spirit in abundance or richly.

Those IN CHRIST were saved (as a matter of fact) (1) through the kindness and love of God in Jesus Christ, (2) according to God's mercy, (3) not on the basis of works (deeds) of righteousness they practiced, (4) through the bathing or washing that came with regeneration (recreation, new birth), (5) through the renewing (to make fresh, new or complete change for the better) accomplished by the Holy Spirit, (6) have been justified (legally declared righteous), and (7) become heirs (sonship) based on the hope of eternal life.
The Gospel in which we IN CHRIST participate and are to proclaim includes (1) abolished death, (2) life, and (3) immortality.

Those not incarcerated in prison yet are not to be intimidated by the prospect, but encouraged to endure all things in order to minister God's Word to the elect of God so they can be saved and mature in a local assembly of followers of Christ.
Unbelievers need to trust God to save them through His Word regarding Jesus\' death and resurrection.
Salvation from sins is by God\'s grace and certain to all who receive Jesus Christ.
God's plan to save by grace through Jesus Christ was made visible in the life, death, resurrection, and ascension of Jesus Christ.
One\'s \"sin reality\" is fully dealt with (from God\'s perspective) adequately ONLY by believing in one\'s heart Jesus died as his/her Savior - for payment of the penalty of sins.
The Holy Scriptures are able to make one wise for salvation through faith in Jesus Christ.
Faith in God\'s salvation in Jesus Christ makes an eternal difference to those who believe and are saved.
To bring salvation to lost and dying man, God came in Jesus through a husband and wife.

Christ-followers should set aside time regularly to REMEMBER from where God delivered them, their spiritual heritage, and their covenant relationship with God: (1) God executed His mercy, grace, power, and guidance to save them from slavery, (2) the shed blood of the Lamb APPLIED brought (and bought) their salvation, and (3) ALL the (completed) WORK necessary to secure the covenant relationship is DONE.
